meanings.definition: The state or quality of being irritable or easily angered.
meanings.sent1: Her waspiness was evident when she snapped at everyone in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: His waspiness often led to conflicts with his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: Despite her waspiness, she always had a smile for her pet cat.
meanings.sent4: The waspiness in his tone made it clear he was not in the mood for jokes.
meanings.sent5: The waspiness in the air was palpable, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent6: After a long day, her waspiness seemed to fade away.
meanings.sent7: The waspiness in the room dissipated as soon as the good news was announced.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a sharp or stinging quality.
meanings.sent1: The waspiness of her words left a lasting impact on him.
meanings.sent2: The waspiness of the cold wind made her shiver.
meanings.sent3: The waspiness of the lemonade caught him by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The waspiness of his criticism stung more than he intended.
meanings.sent5: The waspiness of the thorns made it difficult to pick the roses.
meanings.sent6: The waspiness of the vinegar made her eyes water.
meanings.sent7: The waspiness of the situation made it hard to ignore the tension.
